meanings.definition: A statement that has been proven on the basis of previously established statements.
meanings.sent1: In math class, the teacher explained a theorem about triangles.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on theorems to make conclusions about the natural world.
meanings.sent3: The theorem about cats always landing on their feet made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her success in the competition was a theorem of her hard work paying off.
meanings.sent5: The theorem that plants need sunlight to grow is easy to remember.

meanings.definition: A proposition that is considered to be true based on logic or evidence.
meanings.sent1: The detective's theorem led to the capture of the criminal.
meanings.sent2: The theorem that honesty is the best policy is widely accepted.
meanings.sent3: His theorem that eating ice cream makes you smarter was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The theorem of love conquering all obstacles is a timeless belief.
meanings.sent5: She lived by the theorem that kindness is always the right choice.
